alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Floyd; Knott; Magoffin; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:42PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Perry, northwestern Knott, west central Floyd, central Breathitt and southeastern Magoffin Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 141 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ned, or 10 miles southeast of Jackson, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Rowdy and Sikes around 145 PM EDT. Noble and Ary around 150 PM EDT. Buck, Decoy, Talcum, Bearville and Daisydell around 155 PM EDT. Elmrock, Vest, Evanston and Tina around 200 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Vail, Yellow Mountain, Soft Shell, Waldo, Handshoe, Bolyn, Mid, Mousie, Gunlock, Orchard and Larkslane. THIS INCLUDES Kentucky Highway 80 in Knott County between mile markers 1 and 7, and between mile markers 9 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
